metadata.title: CVE-2020-16845 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - low.
metadata.description:
Go before 1.13.15 and 14.x before 1.14.7 can have an infinite read loop in ReadUvarint and ReadVarint in encoding/binary via invalid inputs.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-16845` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

golang-1.13 - 1.13.8-1ubuntu2.22.10.1
golang-1.13-go - 1.13.8-1ubuntu2.22.10.1
golang-1.13-src - 1.13.8-1ubuntu2.22.10.1
No subscription required

advisory.discovered_by: Diederik Loerakker, Jonny Rhea, RaÃºl Kripalani, and Preston Van Loon

notes.note: mdeslaur> Packages built using golang need to be rebuilt once the vulnerability has been fixed. This CVE entry does not list packages that need rebuilding outside of the main repository or the Ubuntu variants with PPA overlays.

criterions.comment: golang-1.13 package in kinetic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.13.8-1ubuntu2.22.10.1').
